clinical_study.brief_title: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery

collaborator.agency: Hospira, now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery

detailed_description.textblock: The investigator goal is to evaluate the effects of intraoperative and postoperative dexmedetomidine sedation (versus placebo after cardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Sedation Outcome of patients assigned to dexmedetomidine or placebo.
primary_outcome.description: To measure whether dexmedetomidine sedation decreases the incidence of atrial arrhythmias.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sedation Outcome of patients assigned to dexmedetomidine or placebo
secondary_outcome.description: To measure whether dexmedetomidine sedation reduces postoperative delirium.

arm_group.description: Dexmedetomidine infusion, without a bolus dose, (or a comparable volume of placebo) will be initiated before the surgical incision at a rate of 0.1 mcg/kg/hr at the end of bypass, the dose will be increased to 0.2 mcg/kg/hr. Postoperatively patients will continue to receive the study medication at a rate of 0.4mcg/kg/hr. The study medication infusion will be continued for a total of 24 hours from the initial administration time intra-operatively.
normal saline administration matching dexmedetomidine rate of infusion.

intervention.description: Normal saline administration matching dexmedetomidine rate of infusion
